main event: A round, grapefruit-sized object with a bright light was observed by ground radar traveling at high speed to the northwest and disappearing in 10 seconds.
interesting points: The object was reported as a probable meteor sighting.
A separate sighting was reported of a white, round object about 10 feet in diameter and glowing brightly, which appeared and disappeared without warning.
The observers in the second sighting were convinced they saw something unusual, but it was impossible to determine its intelligibility since the report was not made until 7 days later.
The object in the second sighting was estimated to be 80-100 feet in diameter and moved slowly at first before accelerating rapidly and disappearing.
The observers in the second sighting were men of good repute.
sighted object: a round, grapefruit-sized object with a bright light, and a white, round object about 10 feet in diameter and glowing brightly
location: Belton, Missouri and Colorado Springs, Colorado
witnesses: ground radar operators and aircraft observers
